remarks.para: May be partially or completely inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Inoperative components are properly secured, and
Aircraft is operated in accordance with AOM gear down appendix Chapter 5.
Operate aircraft in accordance with Landing Gear Extended performance.
If all landing gear is not to be left extended, use of the following procedure will keep all wheel well doors closed.
Before retraction of operable landing gear, depressurize the hydraulic system associated with the inoperative landing gear: Body and Nose gear Hyd Sys #1, Wing gear Hyd Sys #4.
After gear retraction, position gear lever OFF.
Repressurize the hydraulic system associated with the inoperative landing gear.
Maximum operating speed is 270 KIAS/ 0.73 M.
Maximum takeoff weight is limited to 720,000 lbs.
Apply restricted takeoff climb weights from the Takeoff Climb Limit Weight, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping Chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
RVSM operations prohibited.
Modify ATC flight plan suffix to the appropriate code.
Extended overwater operation prohibited.

If operations are conducted in known or forecasted icing conditions during any part of the flight and if the destination airport has a forecast landing temperature below 8° C, reduce the landing climb limit weight by 78,150 lbs.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ LANDING GEAR TO REMAIN EXTENDED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Configure (pin) the landing gear to be left extended for dispatch per AMM 32-00-00/201. The nose gear and/or main gear (in symmetric wing and body pairs) may be left extended.
If all landing gear are to be left extended, in addition to complying with the step above, the landing gear lever lock circuit breaker (C01435) on the P7 panel must be pulled and collared.
Configure the Mach/airspeed warning system as required by the applicable AOM appendix.
Access the Gear Down Dispatch Switch in the main electronic equipment center.
Remove the safety wire from the switch guard.
Lift switch guard and place switch in the Gear Down Dispatch position.
Close switch guard and install safety wire.
